lines.text:
[to his secretary, Gertrude Houlihan]
Have it mimeographed for the staff, the printer and the complete mailing list.
The linotypers are on strike!
Mrs. Lowndes, I'm getting married.
Well, congratulations.
For what?
Oh, he's nice, all right and I'm not getting any prettier. But, I don't love him.
What was the last thing anybody said?
Sumtin' about - sumtin'.
You don't think I'm crazy do you, Dad?
No.
These things always happen when I eat veal.
You can't tell a woman to meet her dead husband at eight o'clock! You just can't! You, you mean, he's a - live?
I don't know whether I'm asleep or out of my mind or what?
What am I going to do? I have two husbands!
Vicky, will you tell Peter to have dinner at six o'clock so I can go back to the office. The linotypers strike throws our whole schedule into a cocked hat.
Oh! Oh! Get some brandy!
Here I am, a helpless woman!
Well, we'll get along fine, Peter, just, eh, see that the laundry doesn't starch my collars, boil my eggs four minutes, toast dry, coffee black and, eh, don't knock on the bathroom door.
What are you two worried about? I'm the one with the two husbands!
I'm out of your life. Drowned. Forgotten. You found a new love. That makes me an unwanted corpse at a party. I'll go.
No, no dear. We don't feel that way at all. Do we, Henry?
I think he described himself perfectly!
Buck up, Bill! - I'll be waiting
[Playfully walks away and stretches herself out on the stairway banister]
In my room.
Since you men haven't reached a decision, the only proper thing for me to do is to put both my husbands in the guest room!
This used to be a room where a man could take his pants off without feeling ashamed!

[Sarcastically]
Rave on, you wonderful thing!
I'd be sick if I had that in my mouth!
Buck up, Bill!
Close your eyes and - plunge!
handsome, reckless, unreliable, athletic, selfish.
I'm licked, Vicky.
Mrs. Lowndes should be back? Oh well, a woman at her hair dressers.
It fits you beautifully, Mr. Lowndes. I didn't realize, sir, that your shoulders are so broad.
She's been a good little wife.
To both of us!
Where did you go?
Oh, places
Dumps, joints.
I see. The condemned men had a hardy drunk!
Who ruined our lives? Who sent us out to saturate ourselves with liquid poison?
Yes. What did we talk about with every woman that sat down with us?
Vicki. Our wife!
All right, you guys, we'll give you five minutes to get out of them nightgowns then we'll all go downtown.
Do you know what I did when you married Bill, I mean, Mr. Cardew? I kidded myself into thinking that I had married him. That I was you.
Well, there's no harm in that.
Thank you.
[Dreamily stares off into space]
What are you thinking about?
Our honeymoon.
[Smiles]
